column2: nirnie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Fludrocortisone to raise my blood pressure but recently I still had fainting episodes or felt faint. In addition, I've been taking Midodrine for about a month and at first I had no side effects but now my head and chest feel full, my energy level is down and my concentration is affected. However, I haven't fainted again.

column1: Feeling Dizzy Upon Standing from Blood Pressure Drop
column2: Jaxstersc5, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine has been given to me to help higher my blood pressure and help my appetite. So far its not bad other blood pressure meds give me the runs as this one just loosens me up a bit, But I have not seen much of a raise in blood pressure.

column2: Kizanne, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had low blood pressure which was making me have days I had to lie down or fall down.  My doctor prescribed Midodrine 3 times daily. I wanted to just take it on days that I had trouble but he said to take it everyday.  It has made a tredmendous difference so far.  I have energy and feel better.  I have had the side effects of tingling scalp and occasional headaches at night when the medicine wears off.  But it has made a significant daily difference.
